intro: Ceropegia glanduliflora, commonly known as the glandular ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces unique flowers with a distinctive corona that resembles a crown, often in shades of white or yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia glanduliflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unusual floral structure.
